etymologies: mid 18th century (denoting the arrangement of payment by installments): alteration of obsolete estalment (probably by association with installation), from Anglo-Norman French estalement, from Old French estaler ‘to fix’

definitions: a sum of money due as one of several equal payments for something, spread over an agreed period of time

examples.text: the first installment of a grant for housing
the purchase price is paid in installments

shortDefinitions: sum of money due as one of several equal payments for something

definitions: any of several parts of something which are published, broadcast, or made public in sequence at intervals

examples.text: filming the final installment in his Vietnam trilogy

shortDefinitions: any of several parts of something which are published, broadcast, or made public in sequence at intervals

definitions: the process of installing something; installation

examples.text: installment will begin early next year
